G.T.5824
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 28th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front. On the CAMBRAI Battle-front, our troops have taken WELSH RIDGE, N. of VACQUERIE, and are on the line of the canal from MARCOING to N. Of LA FOLIE, with some troops across at MARCOING. We have taken SAN COURT.
In the YPRES salient, the British and Belgian advance continues they are reported to have taken CLERCKEN, HOUTHULST FOREST, WESTROOSEBEKE, are west of PASSCHENDAELE, GHELUVELT, ZANDVOORDE, HOLLEBEKE, WYTSCHAETE. Our troops are said to be advancing on BECELAERE, KRUISEIK, HOUTHEM and MESSINES.
French Front. In the ARGONNE further progress has been made by the French and Americans today. The former have taken MANEN and SOMME-PY and the latter EXERMONT, CIERGES and NANTILLOIS.
2. ITALIAN FRONT.
There is nothing to report.
3. MACEDONIAN FRONT.
Our advance continues. Greek troops are moving east along the crest of the SCHISTA? Range and Anglo-Creek troops are also moving on PETRIC along the STRUMNICA Valley. We have captured several guns of various calibre.
French troops have entered RESNA.
Servian troops have reached RADOVISHTA. The Servians have also captured VELES and, resuming their march on USKUB, have taken KARABUNISTE. In VELES they captured a great quantity of material and a large number of prisoners, many of them Germans.
4. PALESTINE FRONT.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
28th September, 1918.
Issued at 6.30 p.m.
